thread.title: Grumpy Cat is immortalised at Madame Tussauds
thread.title_full: Grumpy Cat is immortalised at Madame Tussauds | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Grumpy Cat is immortalised at Madame Tussauds
text:
156 shares 11
View
comments
She's the most unimpressed feline in the whole world and now internet sensation Grumpy Cat is even more angry with life.
The miserable looking feline, who has nearly 300,000 Twitter followers, is being immortalised in wax at Madame Tussauds in San Franciso - but isn't happy about it, of course.
Despite the fact that her waxwork will be a fancy animatronic with five different movements, she declared: 'I hate it.'
Scroll down for video
Madame Tussauds has announced that Grumpy Cat is to be the first ever feline to be immortalised at its attraction in San Francisco
In order to start the process, the feline tolerated a UK team taking photographs and measuring her for the sculptors
Not only will the cat be Madame Tussaud's first feline, but also the first wax figure in over a century to move in a lifelike manner
The replica of Grumpy Cat will debut at the attraction in late October or early November according to a spokesperson for Merlin Entertainment, which owns and operates the museums.
Not only will the cat be Madame Tussaud's first feline, but also the first wax figure in over a century to move in a lifelike manner.
In order to start the process, the feline tolerated a UK team taking photographs and measuring her for the sculptors.

The traveller who quit studying to visit 97 countries by the... Getting away from it all... in 1948: The fascinating... Share this article Share 156 shares
The modelling process is said to take weeks in order to perfectly capture her cranky disdain in waxen glory.
The paraffin figure will reportedly purr, close her eyes and fall asleep as if thoroughly uninterested in those surrounding her.
After a short stay in San Francisco, the animatronic will tour the remaining five Madame Tussauds attractions across the US.
The modelling process is said to take weeks in order to perfectly capture her cranky disdain in waxen glory
Forget a simple waxwork, the displeased moggy's frown will be brought to life with an animatronic with five different movements
The paraffin figure will reportedly purr, close her eyes and fall asleep as if thoroughly uninterested in those surrounding her
After a short stay in San Francisco, the animatronic will tour the remaining five Madame Tussauds attractions across the US
THE INTERNET SENSATION, GRUMPY CAT, IS NOW A MILLIONAIRE The unimpressed feline shot to fame two years ago in a YouTube video that got 15.7 million views
Last year news broke that the angry feline had amassed a £64million fortune and has earned more than Hollywood stars Nicole Kidman, Cameron Diaz and Matthew McConaughey.
The feline shot to fame two years ago in a YouTube video that got 15.7 million views.
Owner Tabatha Bundesen from Morristown, Arizona, said the two-year-old moggy is 'unstoppable'.
She told The Express : 'What she's achieved in such a short time is unimaginable and absolutely mind-blowing.
'I was able to quit my job as a waitress within days of her first appearance on social media and the phone simply hasn't stopped ringing since.'
Last year news broke that the angry feline had amassed a £64million fortune and has earned more than Hollywood stars Nicole Kidman, Cameron Diaz and Matthew McConaughey
Grumpy was born with dwarfism and an underbite, giving her a disgruntled expression.
She now 869,000 followers on Instagram and 296,000 on Twitter and her face appears on calendars, mugs and T-shirts.
Her first book, Grumpy Cat: A Grumpy Book, was a guide to attaining 'true grumpiness' from the self-appointed 'master of bad attitude'.
Helpful tips included eating ice cream cones to get incurable brain freezes and reminding yourself that a kiss carries more germs than 100 toilet seats.
The follow-up, The Grumpy Guide To Life: Observations By Grumpy Cat, advises that 'It's always good to have a partner in crime - you need someone to blame when people start asking questions'.
She is the 'spokescat' for a Friskies brand of cat food and her latest deal is for her own brand of iced coffee, Grumppuccino.
Her Hollywood debut, Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever, attracted millions of viewers and was the most tweeted about film on its release date.
She now 869,000 followers on Instagram and 296,000 on Twitter and her face appears on calendars, mugs and T-shirts
